titleStmt.title: A speech spoken by His Excellence Prince Rupert to his sacred Majesty, and the Lords of his Privie Councell, at his returne from Redding to Oxford: wherein is freely delivered his opinion concerning the present warre, with his advise for the erecting of forts and garrison townes in this Kingdom, and calling in the old English regiments out of Holland.
titleStmt.author: Rupert, Prince, Count Palatine, 1619-1682.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed at Oxford by L. Lichfield, and now reprinted at London for John Rivers,

notesStmt.note: "This piece has been considered a forgery"--Cf. Madan.
"The Oxford original to this reprint probably does not exist"--Cf. Madan.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
